STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 24, 2025
Jackie L Brown
McBride Appletree YTR Home
4233 Appletree Ln, PO Box 387
Lansing, MI, 48917-1602
Re: License #: CM231002162
Dear Mr. Brown:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on June 10, 2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4125-1-b Personal possessions; money; clothing; storage space
• (1) A licensee shall have a written policy that
designates all of the following:
• (b) The method used to accurately
account for and return possessions and

money to the resident or guardian upon
discharge.
Two of two open files reviewed did not have clothing inventories completed. The
facility does not currently have a system in place to document youth's personal
items coming in or leaving the facility.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-a Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (a) Name, address, birth date, gender,
race, height, weight, hair color, eye color,
identifying marks, religious preference,
and school status.
Two of two youth files reviewed did not have all of the required identifying
information documented at time of admission.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-i Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (i) Documentation that the grievance
policy was provided as required in R
400.4132.
Two of two youth files reviewed did not have verification that the youth were
provided with the grievance policy as required.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-c Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (c) A brief description of the resident's
preparation for placement and general
physical and emotional state at the time
of admission.

One of two files reviewed was a prior admission and the initial documentation was
not updated at time of readmission.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-d Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (d) Name, address, and marital status of
parents and name and address of legal
guardian, if known.
One of two files reviewed was a prior admission and the initial documentation was
not updated at time of readmission.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-e Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (e) Date of admission and legal status.
One of two files reviewed was a prior admission and the initial documentation was
not updated at time of readmission.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-f Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (f) Documentation of legal right to provide
care.
One of two files reviewed was a prior admission and the initial documentation was
not updated at time of readmission.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-g Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:

• (g) Authorization to provide medical,
dental, and surgical care and treatment
as provided in section 14 a (1), (2), and
(3) of 1973 PA 116, MCL 722.124a.
One of two files reviewed was a prior admission and the initial documentation was
not updated at time of readmission.
CCI Rule 400.4152-1-h Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident's case record:
• (h) A brief description of the
circumstances leading to the need for
care.
One of two files reviewed was a prior admission and the initial documentation was
not updated at time of readmission.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• It was recommended that the facility ensure completion of all forms, including
marking all questions with an answer even it is "N/A or None".
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
This is the six-month renewal for Appletree YTR Home and therefore the facility
has not had an annual third-party audit to date. The financial information provided
from the original licensing study did not identify any financial concerns.

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator did
not note any barrier to maintaining compliance with the rules. There were no
CAP's this period under review. All unplanned discharges were due to youth's
being ill or refusing to stay at the respite home.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported they feel very supported by leadership and have appreciated the
constant communication from the House Manager. Staff report feeling well-trained
and did not have any concerns with the functioning of the program.
Youth interview was conducted during the inspection. Youth reported feeling safe,
having all needs met, and had no concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on June 10, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
_____________________________________June 23, 2025
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
